intro: Zinowiewia tacanensis, commonly known as the Tacana lily, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Alstroemeriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often covered in a fine, hairy texture. Zinowiewia tacanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
